Dick Cheney: s personal connection to same-sex marriage: Cheney's second-oldest daughter, Mary Cheney, is openly gay and married her longtime partner in 2012. This personal connection suggests that Cheney may have been more supportive of gay marriage than Hillary Clinton.
Cheney: s differences with President Bush on gay marriage: During the 2004 re-election race, Cheney openly discussed his differences with President Bush on the issue of gay marriage. This further supports the claim that Cheney may have supported gay marriage earlier than Clinton.
Hillary Clinton: s evolving stance on gay marriage: While Clinton initially opposed gay marriage and supported the Defense of Marriage Act, she later came out in support of it in 2013. This contrasting timeline suggests that Cheney may have supported gay marriage sooner than Clinton.
